intro: Cirsium albidum, commonly known as the white thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, hairy leaves and pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often used in herbal medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
